results.title: I am an old tree
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A picture of life in Cuba by a filmmaker who believes in getting into people’s lives and letting ideas seep out of what he finds. Among the people shown are a doctor who came back to Cuba, a high-school student whose school-based radio-assembly work and classes last until 10:00 p.m., and a tobacco farmer who now owns his land. For all of them the new Cuba has done much and promises more.

results.title: I am an engineer
results.brief_description: Intended to stimulate interest in power electrical engineering, this film presents a series of electro-magnetic phenomena on a “why is it so” basis. Professor Eric Laithwaite (electrical engineer) of the Imperial College, London discusses several aspects of work being done, particularly in the field of electro-magnetically propelled vehicles.

results.title: I am also a you
results.creator_credit: Jay Thompson, Bruce Kerner and Wonderful Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates similarity between pople of all ages and points of view, using images and quotations. Sources include the Bible, the Talmud, Buddha, Thomas Wolfe and Stanley Kubrick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: I am a singer
results.brief_description: This award winning interactive CD-Rom weaves a fragmentary narrative about an amnesiac famed for her singing. Exploring notions of performance, autobiography and memory this is an intriguing and compelling story in which the viewer helps to reconstruct the events of a life lived through song.

results.title: I am a mobile librarian
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: The work of a woman librarian in charge of one of the mobile vans which carry the services of the free public library into the remote villages and isolated farms scattered over the country districts of Britain.

results.title: I am a mime
results.brief_description: Antoine Hodek, the Czechoslovakian mime demonstrates the art of pantomime. We learn that mime is a cross between ballet, the theatre and opera. In disarming fashion, Hodek leads the viewer into the pantomimist’s world, devoid of props, scenery and voice. Pantomime and body language are just two of the many techniques used by people to communicate with each other in non-verbal ways.

results.title: I am a mayor
results.creator_credit: John Fletcher, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Indicates the duties of a Mayor in a small town outside London. The many facets of civic administration over which the Mayor, as Chairman of the Town Council, must preside are shown, also the work of different town councillors.

results.title: I am a litter basket
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey, Stewart McAllister and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A jocular contribution to Britain’s anti-litter campaign. It is directed at those who throw their litter everywhere but into the waiting waste-paper baskets.

results.title: I am a guitar
results.brief_description: Shows how Ignacio Fleta and his sons lovingly shape and sand classical guitar frames, apply the inlaid rosette that is their trademark and polish the well-seasoned Cuban cedar, etc that constitutes the kind of instrument Andres Segovia or John Williams would wait a decade to play. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
